answers.answer: I agree with the colonoscopy.  If negative, colon cancer or polyps are less likely possibilities for your rectal bleeding.  Hemorrhoids can certainly be considered, and can be visualized by an anoscopy.If the bleeding continues in light of the negative testing, a bleeding scan can be considered to evaluate for AV malformations.A referral to a surgeon or GI physician can be considered to discuss the aforementioned options.I cannot comment on the clicking feeling without examination.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com

question: Hi,I have small fiber neuropathy which affects my feet, legs, hands, arms, and digestive system. The pain is terrible unless I take my medication.  I get my best relief from Lyrica and Methadone.  Both of these drugs cause constipation and digestive problems.  Because of my lack of ability to excercise, my digestive system has slowed from what it use to be.  I am a 50 year old male who also has diabetes which is under control.Over the past few months I have had evidence of blood during my bowel movements.  I contacted the doctor and he ordered a colonoscopy (November 2005) which was normal.  He stated at the time that I had internal hemroids.  With blood still occuring this fall, the doctor ordered a stool study.  I sent the samples via mail and learned a week later that no blood was present.I decided to make an appointment to see my doctor.  He felt that I could wait until November 2008 to have another colonoscopy, or he would order one for this November.  I decided to go ahead with the colonoscopy right away.  I always have to push hard, or so it seems to relieve myself.  It seems like the blood sometimes just drips into the toilet after pushing.  I also notice a "clicking feeling" when I use my tailbone muscle when sitting...it is hard to decribe.  I take Miralax and another drug to soften my stools on a daily basis.My question is: What do you think could be going on based on the above information?  This has been going on for over a year.  Thank you so much for this service.Jeff
title: Rectal Bleeding
